title: Westminster Special: Local Elections 2022
itunes:title: Westminster Special: Local Elections 2022
description:
Professor John Curtice from Strathclyde University says the local elections are unlikely to produce dismal headlines for the Conservatives despite Labour leading in national polls. He tells Bloomberg's Caroline Hepker and Yuan Potts the results will provide a very interesting snapshot of voters' views across the U.K.'s nations and regions. Plus: Bloomberg Opinion's Therese Raphael says the Foreign Secretary Liz Truss makes a good case for upping the ante against Vladimir Putin, as the politics of non-escalation has failed in Ukraine.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
content:encoded:

Plus: Bloomberg Opinion's Therese Raphael says the Foreign Secretary Liz Truss makes a good case for upping the ante against Vladimir Putin, as the politics of non-escalation has failed in Ukraine.
